com.arib.toast

Class Toast

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • com.arib.toast.Toast
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Toast
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Toast is a class that displays a small message to the user. Its goal is to show the message without taking over control or interfering with the users activities, but still get the message across. Toasts should be only a few words.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • makeToast

        public static void makeToast(java.awt.Component parent,
                             java.lang.String message,
                             long duration)
        The main creation method of a Toast.
        Parameters:
        parent - Which Component is creating the Toast, the Toast will be centered, on the bottom of this component.
        message - The text that will be shown.
        duration - How long to show the message before starting to fade out.
